metadata.name: Shell Invocation Via Ssh - Linux
metadata.comment: Detects the use of the "ssh" utility to execute a shell. Such behavior may be associated with privilege escalation, unauthorized command execution, or to break out from restricted environments.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/ssh')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('proxycommand=;')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('permitlocalcommand=yes')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('localhost'))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/bash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/dash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/fish')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/sh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/zsh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('sh 0<&2 1>&2')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('sh 1>&2 0<&2'))))

output.summary: Detects the use of the "ssh" utility to execute a shell. Such behavior may be associated with privilege escalation, unauthorized command execution, or to break out from restricted environments.
